thig11.1:7.3: The parallel verse at SN 5.5:2.3 has, “There is no-one to whom you are second in the element of beauty” (na catthi te dutiyā vaṇṇadhātu,). The two lines use dutiya (“second”) in different senses, as the ordinal number, and as “companion”. The Therīgāthā commentary offers two explanations, the second of which appears to lean on a version of the line similar to that found in SN 5.5. This, together with the fact that the unusual term vaṇṇadhātu in that line seems like a direct reference to her name, suggests that the SN version may be the original one.
